articleinfo.releaseinfo: This manual describes version 0.9.0 of Encryption Applet

legalnotice.title: Feedback
legalnotice.para: To report a bug or make a suggestion regarding Encryption Applet application or this manual, follow the directions in the Gnome Feedback Page.

sect1.title: Introduccion
sect1.para: Encryption Applet performs the various encryption operations using standard OpenPGP methods. You will need to have already created an OpenPGP key with Encryption Key Manager and imported the public keys of those you want to encrypt to or verify signatures of.

sect2.title: To Add Encryption Applet to a Panel
sect2.para: To add Encryption Applet to a panel, right-click on the panel, then choose Add to Panel. Select Encryption Applet in the Add to the panel dialog, then click OK.
The layout of the Encryption Applet varies depending on the size and type of panel in which the applet resides.

sect1.title: Utilizacion
sect1.para: The Encryption Applet operates on both the Ctrl-C/V and the select/middle click clipboards. Simply copy the desired text using the method of your choice, select the encryption operation from the left click menu, follow the prompts and paste the new contents of the clipboard into your application or view them in a display window after enabling the appropriate option in the

sect1.title: Encryption Applet Preferences
sect1.para: The preferences for the Encryption Applet are part of your Encryption and Keyrings and can be edited by selecting System PreferencesEncryption and Keyrings, or by right clicking on the Encryption Applet and selecting Preferences.

sect2.title: Opcions de visualizacion
sect2.para: These options affect whether or not a window displaying the resultant text is presented following performing an encryption operation. Enabling these options may be of use when reading web based email or handling other encryption tasks where a entry field may not be readily available or immediate display is required.
